item.title: Dumped clothing in sacks, 23rd September
item.description:

item.title: Very poor road conditions, 23rd September
item.description:
This issue has been ongoing for years and allowed to get worse due to lack of maintenance. The road surface is extremely poor with countless dips and uneven surface which are causing a significant amount of issues to myself and my fellow cyclists as I have to swerve around all over the road to avoid them. It would be constructive for Lambeth to listen to their residents concerns and deal with them in a timely manner instead of ignoring them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-16, Drewstead Road, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dogs fouling, 23rd September
item.description:
Constant use by same dog walkers allowing dogs to foul green in mornings and evenings. Smell for local residents is unacceptable and as a result of non removal children especially cannot play on the green. Anyone who walks on green ends up taking dog poo home with them. In adequate signage exists. Also dogs allowed to run freely in the area not on lead. This situation has been going on a long time but there appears to be a lack of interest in Barth Road by council and some residents alike.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barth Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
